basics.name: Anqi Zhao
basics.label: Ph.D. Candidate in Statistics
basics.summary: Ph.D. candidate in Statistics at North Carolina State University with research interests in causal inference, conformal prediction, reinforcement learning for survival analysis, and statistical learning.

education.summary: Advisor: Jungeum Kim. Member of Mu Sigma Rho, the National Statistics Honorary Society.

research.summary: Methodological research on reinforcement learning approaches for survival analysis.
highlights: Reinforcement learning for survival and censored data

research.summary: Research in biostatistics and causal inference.
highlights: Conformal prediction methods for treatment regime learning
Collaboration with Ke Zhu, Jungeum Kim, and Yichi Zhang

research.summary: Econometric research focused on demand estimation.

research.position: Independent Study with Professor Matthew Harding
research.summary: Independent study involving literature review and applied statistical modeling on large-scale advertising and social network data.

teaching.summary: Taught elementary probability and foundational statistical inference, including confidence intervals and hypothesis testing. Held in-person class sessions and office hours.
